content: an easy beginner moss stitch hat to use leftovers of red heart granny square all in one yarn youtube video tutorial https //youtu be/sxtf2oxiojc go with the flow of color changes to create exciting stripes in simple moss stitch- no cutting or controlling of colors needed the hats pictured used 1/3 skein of red heart granny square all in one yarn in the soft white citrus twist colorway and the soft white - green scream 100% acrylic 417 yards 381 m per 250-gram skein that is about 139 yards 127 meters or 83 grams of yarn per hat you can make your hat larger or smaller by adjusting the number of starting chains any odd number of starting chains works for this pattern for an adult hat start with 69 chains for a slouchier beanie crochet more rounds the hats shown have 30 rounds download the free crochet pattern pdf for the lively hat on ravelry here hook 6 5 mm us k gauge 13 stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 13 row = 4 inches 10 cm in moss stitch stitches required chain slip_stitch and single_crochet in us terms the whole hat uses moss stitch which is a repeating single_crochet chain 1 pattern moss stitch is sometimes called linen stitch share your hat with #thelivelyhat on instagram tag me @prettypeacefulcrochet because i love to see your projects please feel free to sell finished items made from this pattern and give design credit as the lively hat crochet pattern by pretty peaceful not for commercial use please do not share photos of this pattern only share the link to the pattern pdf on ravelry or youtube thank you for your support
